page.title: 14the Graveyard
page.content: This is a simple one, walled in with the church, and by an overgrown tarn which must have been full of water flowers in the summer. The gravestones are simple in design and the newest one made of slate is very similar in design to the rest beside it. Some graves are just mounds but it is a cared for place and well kept, with clear and well painted noticeboard. It is quoted in a newly published Bartholomews Guide as an attractive church "because of its tranquility rather than its antiquity". there are names of folk from many countries in the church book, so it would appear that it si well known in church and tourist circles.
